objection: Your commission is too high.
suggested: Reframe as an investment, not a cost. Show value vs. price.

objection: Bahut mehenga hai, itna budget nahi hai mera.
suggested: Offer a trial period, a smaller starter package, or break down the cost.

objection: Is there any discount? Can you give me a better price?
suggested: Explain the value included. Hold firm but offer a non-monetary value-add.

objection: The other company is offering a 5% lower commission.
suggested: Differentiate on features, service, and reliability. 'Cheaper isn't always better.'

objection: Are there any hidden charges I should know about?
suggested: Be upfront. Show a clear pricing table. Highlight what's included.

objection: Itna paisa lagane ke baad, sales nahi badhi toh?
suggested: Share case studies, testimonials, or offer a performance-based incentive.

objection: GST include karke final price batao.
suggested: Provide a clear, final quote immediately to demonstrate transparency.

objection: Payment terms flexible hain? Can I pay in installments?
suggested: Explain the available payment plans. Show empathy for their cash flow needs.

objection: I'm already working with [Competitor Name] and I'm happy.
suggested: Acknowledge and respect the relationship. Ask 'What if we could improve X by 10%?'

objection: Mera purana vendor hai, usse aacha relation hai.
suggested: Don't attack the relationship. Suggest a small, parallel trial.

objection: Everyone in the market uses their platform, why should I use yours?
suggested: Focus on your USP. Highlight niche, service, or specific feature.

objection: I tried a similar service before and it didn't work for me.
suggested: Differentiate clearly. Show how you're different and avoid past problems.

objection: Suna hai [Competitor Name] ka customer support bahut accha hai.
suggested: Showcase your support strength. Provide testimonials or SLAs.

objection: Just leave your brochure, I'll compare and get back to you.
suggested: Secure a follow-up meeting. Suggest a specific time.

objection: They are a big, well-known brand. Are you new?
suggested: Highlight agility, modern tech, personalized service.

objection: How can I trust that your system won't fail during peak hours?
suggested: Discuss uptime stats, infrastructure, and SLAs.

objection: Aapki company kab tak tikegi? What if you shut down?
suggested: Talk about funding, vision, and team experience.

objection: I need to see a live demo with my own products.
suggested: Be prepared to offer a customized or sandboxed demo.

objection: Do you have any clients in my area? Can I speak to them?
suggested: Provide references of happy, local clients.

objection: Your marketing promises sound too good to be true.
suggested: Back up every claim with data or case studies.

objection: Mera data safe rahega? What about data security?
suggested: Explain security protocols, encryption, and privacy policies.

objection: Pehle bhi log aaye the, promise karke service nahi di.
suggested: Acknowledge frustration. Differentiate with clear onboarding and support.

objection: I don't think I'll get enough return on this investment.
suggested: Use an ROI calculator. Show conservative projections.

objection: My business is very small, I don't need all these features.
suggested: Focus on 1-2 key features with biggest impact.

objection: Isse mera fayda kya hoga, seedhe seedhe batao.
suggested: Give a clear 'what's in it for you' statement.

objection: We are doing fine without it, why do we need this?
suggested: Introduce opportunity cost. 'You're doing well, but could be great.'

objection: This seems like a 'nice to have', not a 'must have'.
suggested: Connect product to core business goals.

objection: Free mein jo mil raha hai, uske liye main pay kyun karoon?
suggested: Explain limitations of free tools vs. premium benefits.

objection: How long will it take to see results?
suggested: Provide a typical timeline (30-60 days).

objection: I don't have time for this right now.
suggested: Respect their time. Suggest a short follow-up.

objection: Send me an email with the details.
suggested: Send and book a follow-up slot.

objection: I need to discuss this with my partner/manager.
suggested: Offer a summary sheet for discussion.

objection: Abhi season ka time hai, baad mein dekhte hain.
suggested: Frame it as a way to manage peak season better.

objection: Call me back next quarter.
suggested: Create urgency with limited-time offer.

objection: We are planning a renovation, so we'll decide after that.
suggested: Acknowledge, ask to follow up on specific date.

objection: Let me think about it.
suggested: Uncover real objection (price or implementation).

objection: This seems too complicated. My staff won't be able to use it.
suggested: Emphasize ease of use. Offer free training.

objection: Mere paas iske liye proper computer/internet nahi hai.
suggested: Clarify requirements. Suggest lightweight/mobile-first.

objection: How long will the setup and installation take?
suggested: Provide clear step-by-step timeline.

objection: Will this integrate with my existing billing software?
suggested: Be honest about integrations. Mention APIs.

objection: After-sales service kon dega?
suggested: Explain support channels, hours, and response times.

objection: Mujhe technology samajh nahi aati.
suggested: Reassure them. 'We handle tech, you focus on business.'

objection: Yeh mobile pe aache se chalega?
suggested: Showcase mobile support. Confirm full functionality.

objection: Software update ka kya? Will there be extra charges?
suggested: Clarify updates are included.

objection: My business is different, this won't work for me.
suggested: Use niche case studies to prove relevance.

objection: Mere customers online nahi hain.
suggested: Share local internet stats. Highlight efficiency gains.

objection: I don't have a problem with my current process.
suggested: Ask discovery questions to uncover pain points.

objection: This is only for big restaurants/shops, not for my small cafe.
suggested: Highlight SMB-specific features and pricing.

objection: We get most of our business from word-of-mouth.
suggested: Frame tool as amplification of word-of-mouth.

objection: Is this just another app that I have to manage?
suggested: Position as consolidation tool, reducing other apps.

objection: Mera walk-in customer base aacha hai, I don't need more.
suggested: Talk about future-proofing and resilience.

objection: What is the point of this? Main jaise kar raha hoon theek hai.
suggested: Use simple analogy to explain problem solved.

objection: The decision is up to my son, he handles all the tech.
suggested: Offer joint meeting with son/decision-maker.

objection: I'll do it, but only if you give me exclusivity in my area.
suggested: Explain why exclusivity isn't possible, offer partnership.

objection: I read a bad review about your company online.
suggested: Acknowledge, explain improvements since then.

objection: Your salesperson last year promised me something you didn't deliver.
suggested: Apologize sincerely. Rebuild trust with changes made.

objection: Sab kuch theek hai, par I need it in Gujarati/Kannada/Tamil.
suggested: Be clear about current language support and roadmap.

objection: The contract is too long, I don't want to be locked in.
suggested: Offer shorter-term plan even at higher price.

objection: Okay, let's start with a free trial.
suggested: Agree if available, or explain alternative demo.

objection: The person who came before you was very pushy.
suggested: Set collaborative tone. Emphasize no-pressure approach.
